headline: American Express Stock Sees First Insider Purchase in 2025
summary: American Express  stock is sliding this year, and the card company’s newest director just bought a large block of shares.  American Express shares are about 12 percentage points in the red year to date, far worse than the  In late January, the company reported strong fourth-quarter earnings and raised its dividend, but shares dropped as investors perceived weakness in the company’s guidance.  Its stock fell again in mid-February after its chief financial officer said first-quarter revenue growth would be slower than in the fourth quarter.

headline: American Express rating raised at Baird following persistent market sell-off
summary: Investing.com -- Baird analysts upgraded American Express (NYSE:AXP) to Neutral following a “persistent sell-off in the broader market” that has made it “difficult for us to remain pessimistic on AXP's high-quality franchise.”

headline: Bold Names Season 2
summary: WSJ’s Bold Names brings you conversations with the leaders of the bold-named companies featured in the pages of The Wall Street Journal.  Hosts Tim Higgins and Christopher Mims speak to CEOs and business leaders in interviews that challenge conventional wisdom and take you inside the decisions being made in the C-suite and beyond.  In the first episode of Season 2, Bilt Rewards founder and CEO  Ankur Jain  took inspiration from  American Express’s  rewards programs when his company began offering people loyalty points for paying monthly rent.
